testcase.name: stores/modules/auth/authorisations > initial state > should have a null initial state for features and levelsAuthorisations
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > user context getters > should return default values when no user is logged in
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > user context getters > should reflect currentUser properties
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > hasExpired > should be false if permissionsExpireAt is null
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > hasExpired > should be false if permissionsExpireAt is in the future
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > hasExpired > should be true if permissionsExpireAt is in the past
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > role getters > isUser should be true for USER level and above
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > role getters > isIntegrator should be true for INTEGRATOR level and above
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > role getters > isAdmin should be true for ADMIN level
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > hasCurrentUserAuthorisation (and isUserAllowed) > should return true for admin for any feature/action
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > hasCurrentUserAuthorisation (and isUserAllowed) > should return false if no user is logged in
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > hasCurrentUserAuthorisation (and isUserAllowed) > should return false if user has no permissions object
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > hasCurrentUserAuthorisation (and isUserAllowed) > should return false if user does not have the feature permission
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > hasCurrentUserAuthorisation (and isUserAllowed) > should return false if user has the feature but not the action
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > hasCurrentUserAuthorisation (and isUserAllowed) > should return true if user has the feature and action

stores/modules/auth/authorisations > getters > hasCurrentUserAuthorisation (and isUserAllowed) > should still check permissions even if hasExpired is true (permissions check is independent of expiry for this getter)
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > fetchAllFeatures > should fetch and set all features
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > fetchAllFeatures > should return null on 403 error
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > fetchAllFeatures > should throw ServerError on other errors
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > fetchLevels > should fetch and set levels authorisations
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > fetchLevels > should return null on 403 error
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > getLevel > should fetch authorisations for a specific level
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > getLevel > should return null on 403 error
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > getUserAuthorisations > should fetch authorisations for a specific user
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > getUserAuthorisations > should return null on 403 or 404 error
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > updateUserAuthorization > should call API to update user authorization
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > updateUserAuthorization > should throw error if no userId is provided
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > updateUserAuthorization > should return null on 403 error
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > deleteUserAuthorizations > should call API to delete user specific authorizations
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > deleteUserAuthorizations > should throw error if no userId is provided
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > deleteUserAuthorizations > should return null on 403 error
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > createTemporaryAuthorisationForUser > should call API to create temporary authorisation
stores/modules/auth/authorisations > actions > createTemporaryAuthorisationForUser > should return null on 403 error
stores/modules/users/user > state > should have correct initial state
stores/modules/users/user > getters > isAuthenticated
stores/modules/users/user > getters > currentUserId
stores/modules/users/user > getters > level
stores/modules/users/user > getters > language
stores/modules/users/user > getters > getAllUsers
stores/modules/users/user > actions > initializeAuth > should fetch user if token exists and set as currentUser
testcase.system-out:
Initializing auth: Found token, fetching current user...
Initializing auth: User fetched successfully.

testcase.name: stores/modules/users/user > actions > initializeAuth > should handle API 401 error and remove token
testcase.system-out: Initializing auth: Found token, fetching current user...
testcase.system-err: Initializing auth: Failed to fetch user with stored token. { response: { status: [33m401[39m }, message: [32m'BAD_CREDENTIALS'[39m }

testcase.name: stores/modules/users/user > actions > login > should login successfully, store token, and call fetchCurrentUser which succeeds
testcase.system-out:
[fetchCurrentUser] Start [fetchCurrentUser] Calling API /users/me
[fetchCurrentUser] API call successful [fetchCurrentUser] User set, returning user.

testcase.name: stores/modules/users/user > actions > logout > should call logout API and reset state
testcase.system-out: Initializing auth: Found token, fetching current user...

testcase.name: stores/modules/users/user > actions > fetchCurrentUser > should fetch and set the current user
testcase.system-out:
[fetchCurrentUser] Start [fetchCurrentUser] Calling API /users/me
[fetchCurrentUser] API call successful [fetchCurrentUser] User set, returning user.

testcase.name: stores/modules/users/user > actions > fetchUser > should fetch a specific user
stores/modules/users/user > actions > fetchUsers > should fetch all users and store them
stores/modules/users/user > actions > ensureUsersFetched > should call fetchUsers if usersFetched is false
stores/modules/users/user > actions > ensureUsersFetched > should not call fetchUsers if usersFetched is true
stores/modules/users/user > actions > searchUser > should fetch user by ID
stores/modules/users/user > actions > searchUser > should fetch user by email
stores/modules/users/user > actions > updateUser > should call API to update user
stores/modules/users/user > actions > addUser > should call API to add a user
stores/modules/users/user > actions > deleteUser > should call API to delete a user
stores/modules/users/user > actions > setPreference > should call API to set a preference
stores/modules/users/user > actions > setPreference > should update language and call services
UserModel > Constructor and Basic Properties > should create an instance with provided data
UserModel > Constructor and Basic Properties > should use default values for missing optional data
UserModel > Constructor and Basic Properties > should correctly calculate fullName
UserModel > Constructor and Basic Properties > handles date strings in constructor correctly (simulating old test logic)
UserModel > UserModel.fromAPI() > should create a UserModel instance from API data
UserModel > UserModel.fromAPI() > should handle missing optional fields in fromAPI
UserModel > toAPI() > should return an object suitable for API submission
UserModel > toAPI() > should remove id if it is null (though constructor defaults to 0)
UserModel > clone() > should create a deep copy of the user model
UserModel > isValid() > should return true for a valid user
UserModel > isValid() > should return false for invalid email
UserModel > isValid() > should return false for empty name
UserModel > isValid() > should return false for null name
UserModel > isValid() > should return false for invalid level (0 or less)
UserModel > reset() > should reset user properties to default values
UserModel > UserModel.isEmailInternal() > should return true for internal email domains
UserModel > UserModel.isEmailInternal() > should return false for external email domains
UserModel > hasExpired() > should return false if permissionsExpireAt is null
UserModel > hasExpired() > should return false if permissionsExpireAt is in the future
UserModel > hasExpired() > should return true if permissionsExpireAt is in the past
